# Graph Paper Programming

Write algorithms that your classmates can use to draw pictures.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: For this puzzle, snap all of the blocks together and click "Run" to watch it go!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions: For this puzzle, snap all of the blocks together and click "Run" to watch it go!

authored_hints.courseC_maze_programming1_a: If the bird isn't getting to the pig, make sure all three of the blocks have been fully clicked together, then click "Run" again.
authored_hints.courseC_maze_programming1_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try adding blocks and running the code to see what will happen, even if you don't think you've solved the puzzle yet.

callouts.grade2_CaringForNewPet_0_1: After connecting all the blocks, press "Run" to start your program.

callouts.courseC_maze_programming2_1: This is the toolbox. It’s where you’ll find extra blocks to complete your puzzles.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions:
Help the bird get to the pig. There is one extra blue `move forward` block.

Throw away the extra block by removing it from the other blocks and dragging it back to the toolbox.

authored_hints.courseC_maze_programming3_a:
[][0]

To delete a block from the middle of your code, drag all of the blocks underneath it away to the right and let them sit in the workspace for a while.  

Click on the block you want to delete, and drag it back to the toolbox.

Finally, put your other blocks back in place where they belong.

callouts.courseC_maze_programming3_2: You can drag extra blocks to the toolbox to throw them away.
callouts.stone_block_2: Grey blocks cannot be thrown away.

 block. 

 Choose `cat` or `sloth` to create your first dancer.

-   _You can also click the lightbulb to the left if you want more information or extra challenges._

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Make sure a dancer appears on the screen.

_This level ends after 4 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenges**

-   Choose a different song to play.
-   Move your dancer to a new location.
-   Make more than one dancer.

callouts.dance_callout_01: Choose the type of dancer here.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: Make the cat do a dance move when you press a key.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions:
The [blockly block][0] block lets you run code when you press the arrow buttons. 
Use the [blockly block][1] block to make the cat clap!

_Make sure to press your "up arrow" key or [][2] after clicking the Run button!_

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   The dancer must perform a move.
-   You must press an arrow key.

_This level ends after 4 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

Use more than one [blockly block][0] block.

callouts.dance_callout_11_a: Add this block to your program.
callouts.arrow_buttons: Press the arrow buttons to control your dancer.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: It's time for a dance-off! Program each dancer to move when you press different keys. Choose your favorite move for each dancer or set it to "(Random)" for something totally unpredictable!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions: It's time for a dance-off! Program each dancer to move when you press different keys. Choose your favorite move for each dancer or set it to `(Random)` for something totally unpredictable!

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Both dancers must perform a move.
-   You must press the arrow keys.

_This level ends after 6 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Make a dancer respond to the left and right arrow keys.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: Make your dancer start a new move after the fourth measure.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions:
Let's get the dancers moving in time with the music!

Connect the [blockly block][0] block to a [blockly block][1] block from the toolbox. 

Your dancer should start a new move after the fourth measure.

**Measures** are used to count time in music. In this tutorial, a measure is four beats long.

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   The dancer needs to switch to a new move after 4 measures.

_The level ends after 7 measures._

callouts.dance_callout_02: Add this block to your program!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: Now make the dancer start a new move after 6 measures!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions:
_Now we're grooving!_ 

Add an [blockly block][0] block to your workspace. Make the dancer start a new move after 6 measures.

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   After 6 measures, your dancer needs to be doing a different dance than it was after 4 measures.

_The level ends after 11 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Change the background whenever the dancers switch moves.

callouts.dance_callout_05: Add a new event to your program.

  [blockly block][0]

Now you can create a bunch of backup dancers all at once!

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Create one lead dancer and a group of backup dancers within the first 4 measures of the song.

_This level ends after 7 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Create multiple groups of backup dancers.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: Change the size of the group of backup dancers.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions:
Every dancer has a set of _properties_ that controls what it looks like.

Use [blockly block][0] under a green event block to make dancers appear closer or farther away.

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Change the size of at least one dancer.

_This level ends after 6 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Experiment by changing other properties such as width or rotation.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: Try changing the tint of one of your dancers (or an entire group)!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions: Dancers have a "tint" property that can add a layer of color. Try changing the tint of one of your dancers (or an entire group)!

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Change the tint of at least one dancer.

_This level ends after 6 measures._
authored_hints.tint_hint: Did you notice that your dancers don't change to the exact color you choose? This is because **tints** mix the color you choose with the colors of the dancer.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.short_instructions: Be creative with these new blocks!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursed-2020/l.long_instructions:
This **new block** is a special kind of event that is triggered over and over.

[blockly block][0]

By placing the other new blocks in your toolbox inside the repeat block you can repeatedly change dancers' properties over time. Be creative and have fun!

_When you are done press the Finish button._

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Just press the "Finish" button!
authored_hints.repeat_every_ideas:
**Need some ideas?**

-   Repeatedly change a dancer's size to make it grow.
-   Repeatedly change a dancer's rotation to make it spin.

_You can also use negative numbers to create an opposite effect!_
authored_hints.next_previous:
**Optional Challenge**

-   You can also use this new event block to cycle through a list of dance moves by setting the move to `(Random)`, `(Next)`, or `(Previous)`.
    <xml><block type="Dancelab_changeMoveEachLR">
    <title name="GROUP">???</title>
    <title name="MOVE">"rand"</title>
    <title name="DIR">-1</title>
    </block></xml>

# Back and Forth!

Sometimes you might want to create a pattern of dance moves you choose. This new block lets you do just that.

[blockly block][0]

The moves you choose above will repeat in sequence forever.

-   Create an alternating routine for the lead dancer at the front!
-   Use different numbers to change the rate at which the moves alternate. Try `1` or `0.5` to alternate more quickly!

Check out this dance that uses the [blockly block][0] block to change the backup dancers' formation throughout the dance. Try one of these ideas to extend it:

-   Create a second group of dancers in a different layout
-   Change layout when a key is pressed
-   Change a property when the dancers change formation

# Conditionals With Cards

Play a card game and create rules like "If I draw a red card, I get a point" and "If I draw a black card, you get a point."

answers.feedback: Correct!

answers.text: The bee will move to the cloud and then do nothing, no matter what.

More clouds! 

Check underneath every cloud to see if it is hiding a flower before you get nectar. If there is a flower underneath the cloud, the bee will need to get nectar _once_.  

Remember: Not all clouds hide the same thing!

# Binary Images

Communicate how to recreate an image using just two simple values.

Draw with Binary

Binary is a way of representing information using only two options. In this case, off and on.
Here, we're going to use the number 0 as code for "off" and the number 1 as code for "on".
01

In this stage, we've provided you with a grid of "pixels" that you can walk through and make designs by turning on certain squares!

![](https://images.code.org/c53e00cde9acbae72d02fb9cc2a20e53-image-1483639858942.png)
